If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
cd smb://server/share/manikb/AADRM/
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
change directories to the share
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
dir : Cannot find drive. A drive with the name 'smb' does not exist.
At line:1 char:1
+ dir smb://server/share/manikb/AADRM/
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (smb:String) [Get-ChildItem], DriveNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : DriveNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetChildItemCommand
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.2
OS                             Darwin 17.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.5.0: Mon Mar  5 22:24:32 PST 2018; root:xnu-4570.51.1~1/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hum! I think something it missing from the Repo section.  I use the mount command in either MacOS or in PowerShell latest version and seems to work,

Knowing that "mount" will mount the windows shared folder to the unix folder, then I don't see how using "cd smb://..." cmdline works.

This is what I use to mount and check my SMB's:
```
## - Mounting SMB on MacOS:
mount_smbfs //max_t@sapien01/TempSQLBackups TempSQLBackups
mount -t smbfs //max_t@sapien01/TempSQLBackups TempSQLBackups

## - Check SMB mount 
smbutil view //max_t@sapien01
smbutil statshares -a
```
MacOS: 
```
Maximos-Mac:~ maxt$ sw_vers
ProductName:	Mac OS X
ProductVersion:	10.13.4
BuildVersion:	17E199
```
